; Introduce in coding:
; - for all benefits:  requires factions { all, }
; - building_present govmakedonia - gdy jest jeden konkretny

;____ HARDCODED LIMITS: if you go over these, you're mod will crash:
; - 32 unit TYPES that one can recruit from one building in one settlement
; - buildings per tree: 9
; - building trees: 128
; - hidden_resources Min: 2 Max: 64

;==============================================================================================================================
;---- Buildings conditions and capabilities -----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

;---------------------------- GENERAL INFO ----------------------------

;____ ADDING/REMOVING A BUILDING
;  - in the SSHIP there are a few "technology trees" - some builings are pre-conditions for other buildings to be "buildable".
;  - many buildings are also included as conditions in the triggers for various traits (EDCT file), ancillaries (EDA file), and also feature in the script.txt, descr_missions, descr_diplomacy.
;  - a set of buildings exists at the beginning of the game in the "descr_strat.txt".
; SO:
;  - you should be VERY careful re-coding this file, especially removing the buildings (to put it simply: don't do it).
;  - adding new buildings is easier (especially to the existing branches), but think again of the unintended consequences and the hardcoded limits

;____ LIMIT OF THE NUMBER OF BUILDINGS IN A SETTLMENT
;  - in the Med2 engine there's an unlimited number of buildings that can be built in a settlement.
;  - but the in-game building panel can show max. 24 buildings. The one that are built later one can see only in the building browser (and can also destroy them in this panel: click-righ and then demolish).

;____ BUILDING SHOWN IN THE BUILDING BROWSER
; - any building that has a valid building condition in the EDB will be listed even if not available to be build
; - but:
;   () event_counter conditions need to be true before the building gets displayed;
;      (an always false event counter is sometimes used to hide a special building permanently)
;   () hidden resource has be to present,
;   () the building must be buildable for the culture (NE/EE/SE/GR/ME) 
; - but if you are in a city and you look at the browser of the castle, then the event_counter doesn't work (while the culture condition does).
; - important example: ports are displayed even in the non-coastal provinces (but they will never be buildable).

;____ FEATURES OF THE BUILDINGS CHAINS: if you add at the beginning of the building chain name
;  - "hinterland_" : building will be indesctructible (you can only damage it - through script)
; THIS IS POSSIBLY NOT TRUE:
;  - "temple_" AND city\castle definition : building with "religion" line in the benefits will be automatically destroyed upon capturing the settlement by a faction of different religion, while prefix on it's own only prevents additional buildings with the same prefix from getting constructed.
;    => very limited use: the already existing religious buildings (churches, masjids) have this attribute so it's not possible to give to the other buildings
;    => to destroy landowners you need 5 types of this building (as it's not possible by script)
; THIS IS POSSIBLY TRUE:
; temple_ prefix : only one building with that prefix is allowed per settlement (once one is constructed, any others which would otherwise be available are removed from the lineup
; The auto-destruction of buildings when another faction captures the region is a result of a religion being specified for the chain: any religion other than that of the occupying faction) and city/castle being specified for levels of the chain. 
; What many mods will do when they want a building to be auto-destroyed is give the chain the heretic religion (which no faction has) and specify the levels to be for 'city' even without making a corresponding 'castle' version or vice versa - the building will be auto-destroyed when anybody captures the region.

;____ SSHIP RULES FOR CODING BUILDINGS:
; - building times of "buildings" should be short (a few turns), while building of "infrastructure" (roads, hinterland_farms) should take dozens of turns.
; - specialize: minimise the number of benefits: it's better to have 1-2 large effects than 5-6 average. A building should serve a concrete goal.
; - don't add growth effects at the lower levels (town, large town, motte_and_bailey, wooden_castle) - already trade and fertility provide a lot of growth.
; - growth should be added through additional buildings, not through the core ones - in this way it'll be possible that previously a large city would shrink.

;---------------------------- CONDITIONS ----------------------------

;	using event_counter check with values different thant 1 in EDB might cause a crash  !!!!!!
		
; ORDER: conditions are read by the game from right to left: the engine does NOT give precedence to ANDs before ORs
; - example (A):
;   requires factions { xxx, } and condition1 or factions {yyy, } and condition2
;     is read: ( ( condition2 and factions {yyy, } ) or condition1 ) and factions { xxx, }
;     what means: if factions { xxx, } is false then the entire result is also false, regardless of what else in there is true
;     the upshot is: it is impossible to code (factions{A} and condition1) or (factions{B} and condition2)
; - example (B):
;   (1) mines requires factions { all, } and resource silver or resource marble and building_present_min_level builders builders2
;   (2) mines requires factions { all, } and building_present_min_level builders builders2 and resource silver or resource marble
;      means: (1)silver or (marble and builders2), (2) builders2 and (marble or silver).

; EVENT COUNTERS AS CONDITIONS:
; * can be used for capabilities, in particular: "is_the_player" for recruitment works even if the unit needs more than 1 turn to recruit.
; -- recruit_pool	"Scholarii"  0   0.025   0.9  0  requires factions { byzantium, } and not hidden_resource italy or hidden_resource italy and not event_counter lateran_council4 1
; * don't use "event_counter 0" because before they are set to 1, they do not exist (so they are never true what paradoxicaly makes the whole set of conditions always true)


;---------------------------- NEGATIVE CONDITIONS - COUNTERS & HIDDEN RESOURCES ----------------------------

; (I) as conditions for a building level a trick with a false counter (ie "dummy" that is always "0") must be employed:
; -- hungary_nonecore requires factions { hungary, } and not hidden_resource core_hungary or event_counter dummy 1
; -- hungary_nonecore requires factions { hungary, } not event_counter CONCENTRIC_CASTLES 1 or event_counter dummy 1
; -- stronghold requires event_counter dummy 1 or not event_counter CONCENTRIC_CASTLES 1 and factions { sicily, } or factions { hre, } and hidden_resource sicily
; It will also not work if not all the factions are required. If you need to have it for a subset of factions, do it with event counters, eg:
; -- wonder_steph requires factions { all, } and event_counter faction_turn_catholic 1 and building_present_min_level builders builders1 and hidden_resource hre and not hidden_resource hanse or event_counter dummy 1
; ONLY ONE negative hidden resource may be used with this trick.
; -- ERROR: wonder_tbilisi_narikala_2tower requires event_counter dummy 1 or not event_counter mongols_reach_caucasus 1 and factions { greek, kievan_rus, russia, } and hidden_resource georgia and hidden_resource capital or event_counter dummy 1
; -- OK:   wonder_tbilisi_narikala_2tower requires event_counter dummy 1 or not event_counter mongols_reach_caucasus 1 and factions { greek, kievan_rus, russia, } and hidden_resource georgia and hidden_resource capital
		
; In certain situations consider making state-by-stage conditions; eg. hinterland_farms lvl1 have "no desert", hinterland_farms lvl2 have "no steppes" - but the desert provinces were already excluded in the lower level, so de facto there're two conditions
;
; (II) as conditions for capabilities: can be used
; -- recruitment_slots 3 requires building_present_min_level barracks town_watch and not event_counter freeze_recr_pool 1
;
; (III) as conditions for units: can be used
; -- recruit_pool	"tabargane"  2  0.1  2  0  requires factions { f_rome, } and hidden_resource eastern and not hidden_resource daha and not event_counter ecThureosReform 1
; -- recruit_pool	"triere"  1  0.1  3  0  requires factions { all, } and not hidden_resource liburnes and hidden_resource italy or hidden_resource anatolian
; -- recruit_pool	"arabian"  1  0.08  2  0  requires factions { f_gandhara, } and hidden_resource arabian and not event_counter ecThorakitaiReform 1 or not event_counter ecNabatu_Settled 1


; OUTDATING A BUILDING:
; - if you want make a level of a building available only before a certain event, use this example:
; south_italy_building2_stronghold requires event_counter dummy 1 or not event_counter CONCENTRIC_CASTLES 1 and factions { sicily, } or factions { hre, england, france, jerusalem, papal_states, } and hidden_resource sicily

; CAPABILITIES CODING
; * some capabilities of the buildings depend on the historical events, hidden resources, faction/religion of the builder (but not of the owner)
; * income_bonus bonus -150 : subtracts money but only if there're other buildings in this settlements that add that money (ie it won't have any effect for trade, tax, farming income)
; * two capabilities do not nork but they may be used to provide an in-game visible text for another bonus
; -- recruits_morale_bonus bonus 10  : show the Tradable income bonus (097: not yet implemented)
; -- taxable_income_bonus bonus -10  : shows construction money bonus for stone buildings


;---------------------------- CONDITIONS SPECIFIC TO SSHIP ----------------------------

; SSHIP FREQUENTLY USED COUNTERS (defined in script.txt):
; - is_the_ai 3 - for the AI faction at campaign difficulty level Hard (2 - Normal, 3 - Hard, 4 - Very Hard).
; - is_the_player 1 

; FACTION RULER MONARCH PERSONALITY (EDCT+SCRIPT) increase certain capabilities of buildings:
;	FL_policy_merchant_skills - trade 
;	FL_policy_wise_administrator - construction costs, taxes
;	FL_policy_thinks_of_his_people - population growth
;	FL_policy_strictly_religious - religion
;    a few other - see the script.txt


;---------------------------- CAPABILITIES ----------------------------

; You cannot repeat one faction in capabilities for the same effect happening at the same moment, eg. this is WRONG:
;        law_bonus bonus 1 requires factions { northern_european, }
;        law_bonus bonus 1 requires factions { france, } and not event_counter FL_policy_wise_administrator 1
		
; hinterland_farms
; - farming_level X - increases fertility level of the region (1 pt is 0.5% population growth)
; - farming_level bonus Y - increases the 'income' bonus from hinterland_farms (not yet sure if it works)

; RELIGION
;   religion_level bonus X  - the number can be 0.5 but it will be shown in-game as 0
;   amplify_religion_level Y - increases the effectiveness of the existing religious buildings by 50% per point (e.g. settlement has religion_level = 3 from some building(s) and amplify_religion_level = 2 then it would amplify that 3 by an additional 100% (2 x 50%), i.e. multiply it by 200% (giving an actual religion_level of 6)
; - if you want a building to impact various religions differently, you need to code both effects, eg:
;     religion_level bonus 2 requires factions { northern_european, hungary, poland, southern_european, }
;     religion_level bonus -2 requires factions { middle_eastern, lithuania, cumans, greek, kievan_rus, russia, } and event_counter is_the_player 1
; be aware that the AI never destroys buildings building so the negative impact should always be only for the player

;--- in general: negative effects of a building that can make him destroying a building restrict only to the player as the AI never destroys buildings
;      law_bonus bonus -1 requires factions { middle_eastern, lithuania, cumans, } and not event_counter is_the_player 


;---------------------------- AGENTS -----------------------------------

;  - the number of agents has been reduced in the SSIP by limiting their availability from the buildings.
;  - however, each faction will have access to at least 1 of any type in its capital - in most cases the standard buildings that used to provide those agents (eg. Markets for the merchants, Churches for the priests) have an additional condition: hidden resource "capital". This means that any other initial capital also provides them - if a faction conquers another capital, it will also increase the limit.
;  - a higher level of additional building may increase the limit (like the warehouses lines in Huge Cities), but the main tool are the guilds and specialized buildings (eg. Theologian for priests - but mind they're recruitable from the churches, not the guilds).
;  - in many cases, certain historical events unlock higher limits.

;  - coding WARNING: if you don't have a working (in the very moment) agent limit then you can recruit unlimited number of these agents
;     eg. a code: "agent_limit merchant 1    requires factions { southern_european, } and hidden_resource pisa"
;     will make all the factions other than southern_european and everywhere else than in provinces with HR pisa access to the unlimited number of merchants.
;     A solution: add also additional condition that would work at that moment, eg. " agent_limit merchant 0 " 


;==============================================================================================================================
;---- Recruitment of units ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

;---------------------------- CODING RECRUITMENT ----------------------------

; "recruit_pool	"Scouts"	1	0.06   2  0"  the numbers define:
;     1 - initial number of units
;     0.06 - speed of the refill of the pool (fraction of 1 turn)
;     2 - maximum number of units in the pool
;     0 - experience of the recruited unit

; CONDITIONS
;  - DON'T USE BUILDINGS in recruit_pool lines
;  - direct use works in exceptional cases, eg:
;		recruit_pool	"Unit" 1 1 3 1 requires factions { faction, } and building_present_min_level academic school
;    works only if the building doesn't have entries for other types of capability (eg. law_bonus or free_upkeep)

; RECRUITMENT THAT DEPENDS ON THE EXISTENCE OF 2+ BUILDINGS: make 2 recuitments pools:
;   building 1 provides max pool    (eg. recruit_pool	"Unit" 1 0	2 0 requires factions A, B, C, )
;   building 2 provides pool growth (eg. recruit_pool	"Unit" 0 0.1	0 0 requires factions A, B, C, )
; the second (and more) buildings may provide only the additional recruits - but they should have the same experience as the base building!
;   building 3 provides max pool    (eg. recruit_pool	"Unit" 1 0.2	2 0 requires factions A, B, C, )
;   building 4 provides pool growth (eg. recruit_pool	"Unit" 0 0.1	0 0 requires factions A, )

;---------------------------- RECRUITMENT POOLS ----------------------------

; examples of speeds of refilling of the recruitment pools are:
;	0.03 : 33.3 turns
;	0.04 : 25 turns
;	0.05 : 20 turns
;	0.06 : 16.7 turns
;	0.067 : 15 turns
;	0.07 : 14.3 turns
;	0.077 : 13 turns
;	0.08 : 12.5 turns
;	0.09 : 11.1 turns
;	0.10 : 10.0 turns
;	0.11 :  9.1 turns
;	0.124 : 8,0 turns
;	0.13 :  7.7 turns
;	0.16 :  6.7 turns

; STANDARISED TIMES FOR RECRUITMENT (this is theory and framework, often diverged from - actually, never implemented)
; Rows: consequite events in faciton evolution; Columns: consequtive levels of a building:
;  (I)   0.03 : 33.3 turns,		0.04 : 25 turns,		0.055 : 18.2 turns, 	0.077  : 13.0 turns,	0.11 : 9,1 turns   (differences:  8.3 - 6.8 - 5.2 - 3.9)
;  (II)  0.04 : 25 turns,		0.055 : 18.2 turns, 	0.07 : 14.3 turns,	 	0.09   : 11,1 turns,	0.124 : 8,0 turns  (differences:  7.8 - 3.9 - 3.2 - 3.1)
;  (III) 0.05 : 20 turns,		0.06 : 15.1 turns,		0.085 : 11.8 turns, 	0.11  : 9,1 turns,		0.15 : 6,66 turns  (differences:  4.9 - 3.3 - 2.7 - 2.4)
;  (IV)  0.06 : 16.7 turns,		0.076 : 13.0 turns,		0.1 : 10.0 turns, 		0.13  : 7,7 turns,		0.18 : 5,56 turns  (differences:  3.7 - 3.0 - 2.3 - 2.1)


; important: settlement recruit pool does not get depleted by training units with the mercenary_unit attribute if there're such mercs in this province - don't use this attribute!

;---------------------------- SSHIP SPECIFIC RULES ------------------

; initial numbers of units to be recruited are set to 1 - this is because if a new level of a building is built and it comes with an initial pool, this pool is added to the current one. 

;--- WHAT DIFFERENT TYPES OF BUILDINGS PROVIDE:
; * in the cities recruitment is from "Barracks" that provide urban militias, and also from "Landowners" that provide feudal knights (foot and mounted).
; * in the castles recruitment is from "Castles" for feudal knights, "Barracks" for infantry, "Stables" for cavalry (also horse archers), "Ranges" for missile units, "Arsenal" for gunpowder, "Siege works" for siege non-gunpowder artillery.
; * there're other types of buildings that provide specialized units: mercenary barracks, Military academies, Grasslands (any units for the Cumans). Note that hinterland_farms do not provide any units.
; * the free upkeep is meant (in the SSHIP) only for militias. Remember that it works only if you can recruit relevant unit in that settlement
;      (eg. Cuman free-upkeep cavalry that is recruitable from grasslands, won't have free upkeep in the European cities without grasslands)
; - AoR units: infantry available from barracks in both cities and castles; while missiles only from ranges (ie castles), and cavalry from stables (ie castles)
; - unique buildings provide additional recruitment pools' for the particular factions - in this way each faction has recruitment hub(s)

;--- RECRUITMENT OF SHIPS: see the beginning of the Port building section.

		
;---------------------------- SUPPORT FOR THE AI RECRUITMENT------------------

; - only for better units so that it fields better quality armies for the player's better experience
; - a building line must provide for the recruitment, but it may also be from a higher level of the building
; - if the building provides the unit, then code only recruitment pool refreshment: 0 0.25 0 0 (important: even experience must be identical to the base unit - otherwise two different units will be produced)
; - if the building does not provides the unit, then code everything: 1	0.25 2 0
; - provide a large increase every 4 turns (this is the role of the event_counter leap_year_counter X)
;   so that the it's more likely that a few units will be available to the AI in one turn, not one unit every few turns
;   -> this should induce the AI into creating one larger army, not send units separately.
; - admitedely, the Landowners building was coded before this idea and the support for the AI is done conventionally: additional unit without leap effect.

; They may be used as conditions here (EDB) and in EDU; I haven't seen it used in mercenaries or script but maybe it's possible.

;==============================================================================================================================
;==============================================================================================================================
;---- Core: city       --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
;==============================================================================================================================
;==============================================================================================================================
; core buildings are de facto undesctructible: script can destroy the building on the campaign map but it wouldn't affect the level of the settlement
; 


;@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@
building core_building
{
  convert_to core_castle_building
  levels wooden_pallisade wooden_wall stone_wall large_stone_wall huge_stone_wall
  {
;==================================================================================================================================
;===================  WOODEN PALLISADE   ==========================================================================================
;==================================================================================================================================

    wooden_pallisade city requires factions { all, } and building_present hinterland_roads or hidden_resource cumans or hidden_resource desert
    {                                                                                                                                
      convert_to 1
      capability
      {
;---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
; WOODEN PALLISADE - GENERAL

		wall_level 0
        tower_level 1

;---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
; WOODEN PALLISADE - FREE UPKEEP

		free_upkeep bonus 1 requires not factions { mongols, cumans, } and not event_counter FL_policy_protector 1
		free_upkeep bonus 2 requires not factions { mongols, cumans, } and event_counter FL_policy_protector 1

;---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------	
; WOODEN PALLISADE - CONSTRUCTION DISCOUNTS

		construction_cost_bonus_religious bonus 20 requires event_counter FL_policy_strictly_religious 1 and event_counter is_the_player 1

        construction_cost_bonus_wooden bonus 10 requires event_counter FL_policy_wise_administrator 1 and event_counter is_the_player 1
		construction_cost_bonus_stone bonus 10 requires event_counter FL_policy_wise_administrator 1 and event_counter is_the_player 1
        taxable_income_bonus bonus -10 requires event_counter FL_policy_wise_administrator 1 			; must be here to provide text about discount for stone buildings		

		;--- FOR AI: ensures it builds and repairs buildings even if close to debt
        construction_cost_bonus_wooden bonus 99 requires event_counter is_the_ai 1
		construction_cost_bonus_stone bonus 99 requires event_counter is_the_ai 1

;---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
; WOODEN PALLISADE - RECRUITMENT SLOTS

	; Previous idea dropped because the engine produces a buggy result: one recruitment slot more as bonus for clearing the land (farms2). It consisted of the following code:
	;	recruitment_slots 1 requires factions { all, } and event_counter is_the_player 1 and not event_counter freeze_recr_pool 1 and not building_present_min_level hinterland_farms farms2 and not event_counter faction_size_small 1
	;	recruitment_slots 2 requires factions { all, } and event_counter is_the_player 1 and not event_counter freeze_recr_pool 1 and building_present_min_level hinterland_farms farms2 and not event_counter faction_size_small 1

		;--- STANDARD
		recruitment_slots 1 requires factions { all, } and event_counter is_the_player 1 and not event_counter freeze_recr_pool 1 and not event_counter faction_size_small 1
		;--- SMALL FACTION
        recruitment_slots 2 requires factions { all, } and event_counter is_the_player 1 and not event_counter freeze_recr_pool 1 and event_counter faction_size_small 1
		;--- FOR AI
        recruitment_slots 2 requires factions { all, } and event_counter is_the_ai 1 and not event_counter freeze_recr_pool 1

;---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
; WOODEN PALLISADE - EXPERIENCE BONUS FOR AI

		recruits_exp_bonus bonus 1 requires event_counter ai_level_hard 1 and event_counter late_era 1
		recruits_exp_bonus bonus 2 requires event_counter ai_level_hard 1 and event_counter high_era 1

		recruits_exp_bonus bonus 1 requires event_counter ai_level_veryhard 1 and event_counter early_era 1		
		recruits_exp_bonus bonus 2 requires event_counter ai_level_veryhard 1 and event_counter high_era 1
		recruits_exp_bonus bonus 3 requires event_counter ai_level_veryhard 1 and event_counter late_era 1

;---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
; WOODEN PALLISADE - MORALE BONUS FOR AI

        recruits_morale_bonus bonus 1 requires event_counter ai_level_medium 1
        recruits_morale_bonus bonus 2 requires event_counter ai_level_hard 1
        recruits_morale_bonus bonus 3 requires event_counter ai_level_veryhard 1

;---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------	
; WOODEN PALLISADE - RELIGION BONUSES

		religion_level bonus 1 requires event_counter FL_policy_strictly_religious 1 and event_counter is_the_player 1

		;--- FOR AI
		religion_level bonus 1 requires event_counter ai_level_hard 1
		religion_level bonus 2 requires event_counter ai_level_veryhard 1

;---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
; WOODEN PALLISADE - POPULATION GROWTH
; keep it low in normal times as growth should come from the other buildings
; civil war negative effect comes through happiness channel below
; the AI at H and VH is able to upgrade the settlements very fast - to solve this a nerf for bonuses from other sources is introduced


	;--- AI NERF FOR EARLY ERA
        population_health_bonus bonus -2 requires event_counter is_the_ai 1 and event_counter early_era 1
        population_growth_bonus bonus -2 requires event_counter is_the_ai 1 and event_counter early_era 1
	;--- FACTION LEADER
		; none at this level
	;--- BLACK DEATH
        population_growth_bonus bonus -1 requires event_counter BLACK_DEATH_HITS 1 and not event_counter BLACK_DEATH_4 1
		
;---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
; WOODEN PALLISADE - HAPPINES & LAW

; FOR AI - creation of larger empires is easier for the AI

		happiness_bonus bonus 1 requires event_counter is_the_ai 1 and event_counter early_era 1		
		happiness_bonus bonus 2 requires event_counter is_the_ai 1 and event_counter high_era 1
		happiness_bonus bonus 3 requires event_counter is_the_ai 1 and event_counter late_era 1

; AGGRESSIVE PLAYER - 

		happiness_bonus bonus -4 requires event_counter is_the_player 1 and event_counter player_aggressivity_level_4 1 and not hidden_resource cumans
		happiness_bonus bonus -3 requires event_counter is_the_player 1 and event_counter player_aggressivity_level_3 1 and not hidden_resource cumans
		happiness_bonus bonus -2 requires event_counter is_the_player 1 and event_counter player_aggressivity_level_2 1 and not hidden_resource cumans
		happiness_bonus bonus -1 requires event_counter is_the_player 1 and event_counter player_aggressivity_level_1 1 and not hidden_resource cumans

; STEPPES - it is difficult to control the steppes for the non-steppe factions

		happiness_bonus bonus -6 requires not factions { slave, cumans, mongols, } and event_counter early_era 1 and hidden_resource cumans
		happiness_bonus bonus -5 requires not factions { slave, cumans, mongols, } and event_counter high_era 1 and hidden_resource cumans
		happiness_bonus bonus -4 requires not factions { slave, cumans, mongols, } and event_counter late_era 1 and hidden_resource cumans

; MONGOLS - initial low taxes and terror of rule help them to keep settlements not rioting

		happiness_bonus bonus 3 requires factions { mongols, } and event_counter mongols_invasion_stage_1 1
		happiness_bonus bonus 3 requires factions { mongols, } and event_counter mongols_invasion_stage_2 1
		happiness_bonus bonus 3 requires factions { mongols, } and event_counter mongols_invasion_stage_3 1
		happiness_bonus bonus 2 requires factions { mongols, } and event_counter mongols_invasion_stage_4 1
		happiness_bonus bonus 1 requires factions { mongols, } and event_counter mongols_invasion_stage_5 1
		
; CIVIL WAR

		happiness_bonus bonus -6 requires factions { spain, } and event_counter civil_war_spain_going_on 1
		happiness_bonus bonus -6 requires factions { aragon, } and event_counter civil_war_aragon_going_on 1
		happiness_bonus bonus -6 requires factions { france, } and event_counter civil_war_france_going_on 1

		happiness_bonus bonus -6 requires factions { byzantium, } and event_counter civil_war_byzantium_going_on 1
		happiness_bonus bonus -6 requires factions { georgia, } and event_counter civil_war_georgia_going_on 1
		happiness_bonus bonus -6 requires factions { russia, } and event_counter civil_war_russia_going_on 1
		happiness_bonus bonus -6 requires factions { kievan_rus, } and event_counter civil_war_kievan_rus_going_on 1
		happiness_bonus bonus -6 requires factions { cumans, } and event_counter civil_war_cumans_going_on 1
		happiness_bonus bonus -6 requires factions { lithuania, } and event_counter civil_war_lithuania_going_on 1

		law_bonus bonus -4 requires factions { spain, } and event_counter civil_war_spain_going_on 1
		law_bonus bonus -4 requires factions { aragon, } and event_counter civil_war_aragon_going_on 1
		law_bonus bonus -4 requires factions { france, } and event_counter civil_war_france_going_on 1

      upgrades

        wooden_wall

;===================  WOODEN WALL   ==========================================================================================================================================
;=============================================================================================================================================================================

    {

        wall_level 1

; keep it low in normal times as growth should come from the other buildings

        population_health_bonus bonus -2 requires event_counter is_the_ai 1 and event_counter early_era 1

		happiness_bonus bonus -4 requires event_counter is_the_player 1 and event_counter player_aggressivity_level_4 1 and not hidden_resource cumans
		happiness_bonus bonus -3 requires event_counter is_the_player 1 and event_counter player_aggressivity_level_3 1 and not hidden_resource cumans

		construction_cost_bonus_stone bonus 99 requires event_counter is_the_ai 1

		happiness_bonus bonus 1 requires event_counter is_the_ai 1 and event_counter early_era 1
		happiness_bonus bonus 2 requires event_counter is_the_ai 1 and event_counter high_era 1
		happiness_bonus bonus 3 requires event_counter is_the_ai 1 and event_counter late_era 1

; AGGRESSIVE PLAYER - 

		happiness_bonus bonus -4 requires event_counter is_the_player 1 and event_counter player_aggressivity_level_4 1 and not hidden_resource cumans
		happiness_bonus bonus -3 requires event_counter is_the_player 1 and event_counter player_aggressivity_level_3 1 and not hidden_resource cumans
		happiness_bonus bonus -2 requires event_counter is_the_player 1 and event_counter player_aggressivity_level_2 1 and not hidden_resource cumans
		happiness_bonus bonus -1 requires event_counter is_the_player 1 and event_counter player_aggressivity_level_1 1 and not hidden_resource cumans

; STEPPES - it is difficult to control the steppes for the non-steppe factions

		happiness_bonus bonus -8 requires not factions { slave, cumans, mongols, } and event_counter early_era 1 and hidden_resource cumans
		happiness_bonus bonus -6 requires not factions { slave, cumans, mongols, } and event_counter high_era 1 and hidden_resource cumans
		happiness_bonus bonus -5 requires not factions { slave, cumans, mongols, } and event_counter late_era 1 and hidden_resource cumans
		
; MONGOLS - initial low taxes and terror of rule help them to keep settlements not rioting

		happiness_bonus bonus 5 requires factions { mongols, } and event_counter mongols_invasion_stage_1 1
		happiness_bonus bonus 5 requires factions { mongols, } and event_counter mongols_invasion_stage_2 1
		happiness_bonus bonus 5 requires factions { mongols, } and event_counter mongols_invasion_stage_3 1
		happiness_bonus bonus 3 requires factions { mongols, } and event_counter mongols_invasion_stage_4 1
		happiness_bonus bonus 2 requires factions { mongols, } and event_counter mongols_invasion_stage_5 1
		happiness_bonus bonus 1 requires factions { mongols, } and event_counter mongols_invasion_stage_6 1

; CIVIL WAR

		happiness_bonus bonus -5 requires factions { spain, } and event_counter civil_war_spain_going_on 1
		happiness_bonus bonus -5 requires factions { aragon, } and event_counter civil_war_aragon_going_on 1

;===================  CASTLE  =====================================================================================================

    castle castle requires factions { northern_european, southern_european, eastern_european, greek, middle_eastern, } and building_present_min_level hinterland_farms farms2 and building_present_min_level builders builders1
    {
      convert_to 1
      capability
      {
;----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
; CASTLE - GENERAL
		wall_level 2
        tower_level 1
        gate_strength 3

;---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
; CASTLE - FREE UPKEEP

		free_upkeep bonus 3 requires not factions { mongols, cumans, } and not event_counter FL_policy_protector 1
		free_upkeep bonus 4 requires not factions { mongols, cumans, } and event_counter FL_policy_protector 1
		
;---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
; CASTLE - RELIGION BONUSES FOR AI
		religion_level bonus 2 requires event_counter ai_level_veryhard 1
		religion_level bonus 1 requires event_counter ai_level_hard 1

;---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------	
; CASTLE - POPULATION GROWTH
; keep it low in normal times as growth should come from the other buildings
; civil war negative effect comes through happiness channel below

	;--- AI NERF FOR EARLY ERA
        population_health_bonus bonus -2 requires event_counter is_the_ai 1 and event_counter early_era 1
        population_growth_bonus bonus -2 requires event_counter is_the_ai 1 and event_counter early_era 1
		
	;--- FACTION LEADER
        population_growth_bonus bonus 2 requires event_counter FL_policy_thinks_of_his_people 1

	;--- BLACK DEATH
        population_growth_bonus bonus -2 requires event_counter BLACK_DEATH_HITS 1 and not event_counter BLACK_DEATH_4 1

;---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
; CASTLE - CONSTRUCTION DISCOUNTS

		construction_cost_bonus_religious bonus 20 requires event_counter FL_policy_strictly_religious 1 and event_counter is_the_player 1
		construction_time_bonus_defensive bonus 40 requires event_counter FL_policy_strictly_religious 1 and event_counter is_the_player 1

        construction_cost_bonus_stone bonus 10 requires event_counter FL_policy_wise_administrator 1 and event_counter is_the_player 1
        taxable_income_bonus bonus -10 requires event_counter FL_policy_wise_administrator 1 	; must be here to provide text about discount for stone buildings
        construction_cost_bonus_wooden bonus 10 requires event_counter FL_policy_wise_administrator 1 and event_counter is_the_player 1

		;--- FOR AI: ensures it builds and repairs buildings even if close to debt
        construction_cost_bonus_wooden bonus 99 requires event_counter is_the_ai 1
		construction_cost_bonus_stone bonus 99 requires event_counter is_the_ai 1

;---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
; CASTLE - RECRUITMENT SLOTS

		;--- STANDARD
		recruitment_slots 3 requires factions { all, } and event_counter is_the_player 1 and not event_counter freeze_recr_pool 1 and not event_counter faction_size_small 1
		;--- SMALL FACTION
        recruitment_slots 4 requires factions { all, } and event_counter is_the_player 1 and not event_counter freeze_recr_pool 1 and event_counter faction_size_small 1
		;--- FOR AI
        recruitment_slots 4 requires factions { all, } and event_counter is_the_ai 1 and not event_counter freeze_recr_pool 1

        recruits_morale_bonus bonus 1 requires event_counter ai_level_hard 1
        recruits_morale_bonus bonus 2 requires event_counter ai_level_veryhard 1

;---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
; CASTLE - HAPPINES & LAW

; FOR AI - creation of larger empires is easier for the AI

		happiness_bonus bonus 2 requires event_counter is_the_ai 1 and event_counter early_era 1

    citadel castle requires factions { northern_european, southern_european, eastern_european, greek, middle_eastern, } and building_present_min_level builders builders3
    {
      convert_to 2
      capability
      {
;----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
; CITADEL - GENERAL
		wall_level 4
        tower_level 1
        gate_strength 5

;---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
; CITADEL - FREE UPKEEP

		free_upkeep bonus 4 requires not factions { mongols, cumans, } and not event_counter FL_policy_protector 1
		free_upkeep bonus 6 requires not factions { mongols, cumans, } and event_counter FL_policy_protector 1

;---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
; CITADEL - RELIGION BONUSES FOR AI
		religion_level bonus 2 requires event_counter ai_level_veryhard 1
		religion_level bonus 1 requires event_counter ai_level_hard 1

;---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------	
; CITADEL - POPULATION GROWTH
; keep it low in normal times as growth should come from the other buildings
; civil war negative effect comes through happiness channel below

	;--- FACTION LEADER
        population_growth_bonus bonus 5 requires event_counter FL_policy_thinks_of_his_people 1

	;--- BLACK DEATH
        population_growth_bonus bonus -5 requires event_counter BLACK_DEATH_HITS 1 and not event_counter BLACK_DEATH_4 1

;---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
; CITADEL - CONSTRUCTION DISCOUNTS

		construction_cost_bonus_religious bonus 20 requires event_counter FL_policy_strictly_religious 1 and event_counter is_the_player 1
		construction_time_bonus_defensive bonus 40 requires event_counter FL_policy_protector 1 and event_counter is_the_player 1

        construction_cost_bonus_stone bonus 10 requires event_counter FL_policy_wise_administrator 1 and event_counter is_the_player 1
        taxable_income_bonus bonus -10 requires event_counter FL_policy_wise_administrator 1 	; must be here to provide text about discount for stone buildings
        construction_cost_bonus_wooden bonus 10 requires event_counter FL_policy_wise_administrator 1 and event_counter is_the_player 1
        
		;--- FOR AI: ensures it builds and repairs buildings even if close to debt
        construction_cost_bonus_wooden bonus 99 requires event_counter is_the_ai 1
		construction_cost_bonus_stone bonus 99 requires event_counter is_the_ai 1

;---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
; CITADEL - RECRUITMENT SLOTS

		;--- STANDARD

;==============================================================================================================================
;==============================================================================================================================
;---- Roads -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
;==============================================================================================================================
;==============================================================================================================================
; additional conditions to make building roads in the deserts and steppes impossible have been added:
; it is done through hidden resources "desert" (5 provinces with desert) and "tartars" (17 provinces with steppes)
; with the trick off using a dummy (always negative) condition (see begining of this file a throrough explanation)
;
; As the game engine doesn't allow using more hidden resources as negative conditions for builing the buildings - if you want to add also eg. desert regions you'll need to make it through positive conditions, eg.
; (A) 1) create hidden resources "gravel_roads" and "paved_roads". 2) assign them to all relevant provinces. 3) include below as conditions.
; (B) create event_counters in the script and employ here.

; roads are undesctructible: script can destroy the road building but it doesn't affect the road itself (the effects road_level will linger, the graphics on the map as well)
; for the roads to be damaged after a conquest of a settlement a script must be added (it's done for some settlements)

; FURTHER MODDING:
; - the third level is now available only for Byzantium - it could be made dependent on a certain historical counter


;@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@    ROADS
building hinterland_roads
{
  convert_to hinterland_castle_roads
  levels roads paved_roads highways
  {
;==================================================================================================================================
;===================  DIRT TRACKS (previously roads)  =============================================================================
;==================================================================================================================================  
    roads city requires factions { northern_european, southern_european, eastern_european, greek, middle_eastern, } and event_counter dummy 1 or not hidden_resource desert
    {
      convert_to 0
      capability
      {
        road_level 0
		trade_base_income_bonus bonus 1 requires not event_counter FL_policy_thinks_of_his_people 1
		trade_base_income_bonus bonus 2 requires event_counter FL_policy_thinks_of_his_people 1
        trade_base_income_bonus bonus 1 requires event_counter ai_level_hard 1
        trade_base_income_bonus bonus 2 requires event_counter ai_level_veryhard 1
;---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
; UPKEEP/INCOME		
		income_bonus bonus 100		
	  }
      material wooden
      construction  20
      cost  2000
      settlement_min village
      upgrades
      {
        paved_roads
      }
    }
;==================================================================================================================================
;===================  ROADS (previously Paved Roads)   ============================================================================
;==================================================================================================================================	
    paved_roads city requires factions { northern_european, southern_european, eastern_european, greek, middle_eastern, } and event_counter dummy 1 or not hidden_resource tartars
    {
      convert_to 1
      capability
      {
        road_level 1
		
		trade_base_income_bonus bonus 2 requires not event_counter FL_policy_thinks_of_his_people 1
		trade_base_income_bonus bonus 4 requires event_counter FL_policy_thinks_of_his_people 1
		
        trade_base_income_bonus bonus 2 requires event_counter ai_level_hard 1
        trade_base_income_bonus bonus 4 requires event_counter ai_level_veryhard 1
;---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
; UPKEEP/INCOME		
		income_bonus bonus 200
	  }
      material stone
      construction  20
      cost  7500
      settlement_min city
      upgrades
      {
        highways
      }
    }
;==================================================================================================================================
;===================  HIGHWAYS (aka Paved Roads)   ================================================================================
;==================================================================================================================================	
    highways city requires factions { byzantium, } and event_counter dummy 1 or not hidden_resource tartars
    {
      convert_to 2
      capability
      {
        road_level 2
        population_growth_bonus bonus 5
		
		trade_base_income_bonus bonus 4 requires not event_counter FL_policy_thinks_of_his_people 1
		trade_base_income_bonus bonus 8 requires event_counter FL_policy_thinks_of_his_people 1
		
        trade_base_income_bonus bonus 2 requires event_counter ai_level_hard 1
        trade_base_income_bonus bonus 4 requires event_counter ai_level_veryhard 1
;---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
; UPKEEP/INCOME		
		income_bonus bonus 400
      }
      material stone
      construction  20
      cost  15000
      settlement_min large_city
      upgrades
      {
      }
    }
  }
  plugins
  {
  }
}

        road_level 0
		trade_base_income_bonus bonus 1 requires not event_counter FL_policy_thinks_of_his_people 1
		trade_base_income_bonus bonus 2 requires event_counter FL_policy_thinks_of_his_people 1
        trade_base_income_bonus bonus 1 requires event_counter ai_level_hard 1
        trade_base_income_bonus bonus 2 requires event_counter ai_level_veryhard 1

		income_bonus bonus 100

      {
        c_paved_roads
      }
    }
;==================================================================================================================================

    c_paved_roads castle requires factions { northern_european, southern_european, eastern_european, greek, middle_eastern, } and event_counter dummy 1 or not hidden_resource tartars
    {
      convert_to 1
      capability

;---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
; UPKEEP/INCOME		
		income_bonus bonus 200
      }
      material stone
      construction  20
      cost  7500
      settlement_min city
      upgrades

        c_highways
      }
    }

;==============================================================================================================================
;==============================================================================================================================
;---- Agriculture (farms) -----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
;==============================================================================================================================
;==============================================================================================================================
;
; Any transformation of land was very, very lenghty in practice. This is reflected in the long times to build each level.
; Additionaly, the third step (Land Clearance) is de facto a pre-requisite of the development of the heavy-wooded provinces of the north (ie you need a long time of rather cheap investements to make those provinces profitable).
; No "landowners" are in requirements for hinterland_farms because of historicity: there might have been autonomy (ie no landowners) in a province, and yet advanced estates were built.

; Coding:
; - you can only use one "not hidden_resource" and only with "event_counter dummy 1" and you must include all factions in this condition (see discussion at the beginning of this file)
; - names of the farms are not hardcoded so they can be - and were - modified. Nomenclature here does not follow now the logic of other SSHIP buildings numbering because there're 2 levels of hinterland_farms at town level (so it's +1 for upper levels). It doesn't matter unless a modder is inattentive.
; - hidden resources used:
; -- HR desert in present in 9 provinces, but some already have lvl1 farms built at the beginning of the game (so only in those will it be possible to build higher levels of farms - and then of core_buildings).
; -- HR cumans (= deep steppes) is present in 7 provinces, but some provinces have already lvl2 farms  (so only in those will it be possible to build higher levels of farms - and then of core_buildings).
; -- HR abbasid and HR egypt - there are also sandy provinces having this HR (that would have triggered extremely high fertility of the upper levels of farms) but they will not be able to build those farms of higher levels because they are excluded by their HR desert.
; - resources used below: wine , grain , ivory -> Oil , tobacco -> Salt , dogs -> Fruits , camels -> Honey , elephants -> Cattle

; Capabilities:
; - for whatever reason "farming_level bonus" provides equivalent to "farming_level" (i.e. not only income but also growth) so in coding it was omitted, despite initial intentions to use it.
; - recruitment_slots are not here, as they're tied to the Core buildings.

; Climate disasters possible to code:
; (A) Historcial bad climate era: let's simplify it at say it was in 14c. Counters: new_era_begins (1300) and late_era (1390)
; (B) Possible recurent script: bad/good harvests (eg due to an eruption of vulcano in Indenesia/Island)
;	farming_level 3 requires event_counter Field_bad 1 and event_counter is_the_player 1
;   farming_level 4 requires event_counter Field_normal 1 and event_counter is_the_player 1
;   farming_level 4 requires not event_counter is_the_player 1
;   farming_level 5 requires event_counter Field_good 1 and event_counter is_the_player 1  
; It makes no sense to make it for less than a number (10+?) years and it would require historical event to be known by the player.


;@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@    hinterland_farms
building hinterland_farms
{
  convert_to hinterland_farms
  levels farms0 farms1 farms2 farms3 farms4 farms5 farms6
  {
;==================================================================================================================================
;===================   PASTORAL FARMING   =========================================================================================
;==================================================================================================================================	 
    farms0 requires factions { northern_european, middle_eastern, eastern_european, greek, southern_european, } and event_counter dummy 1 or not hidden_resource desert
    {
      convert_to 0
      capability
      {
		farming_level 1 requires factions { all, } and resource grain and resource wine or resource ivory or resource tobacco or resource dogs or resource camels
		farming_level 1 requires factions { all, } and resource elephants

;---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
; UPKEEP/INCOME		
		income_bonus bonus 50
		}
      material wooden
      construction  20
      cost  1000
      settlement_min village
      upgrades
      {
        farms1
      }
    }
;==================================================================================================================================

;==================================================================================================================================
;==================================================================================================================================
;---- Builders --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
;==================================================================================================================================
; Roles and benefits:
; * first level at T1 can be built only after roads in the province are built.
; * all factions can build them anywhere, but in some provinces they'd provide less benefits (ie wood-less ones: no discount on wood buildings, while with in marble/timber resource more income).
; * they condition building of a number of other buildings, but have no impact on recruitment.
; * population growth only at higher levels so that they don't enable building towns without hinterland_farms etc.
; * they do cost UPKEEP so that the player faces a choice: will be able to build better buildings but must pay for it.
; Technical:
; there're no in-game text (yet?) for discount on building wooden buildings.


;@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@    BUILDERS
building builders
{
  convert_to builders
  levels builders1 builders2 builders3 builders4
  {
;==================================================================================================================================
;===================   BUILDERS 1 (Logging Camps)   ===============================================================================
;==================================================================================================================================	   
    builders1 requires factions { northern_european, middle_eastern, eastern_european, greek, southern_european, } and not building_present_min_level grasslands nomad_headquarters and building_present hinterland_roads or building_present hinterland_castle_roads
    {
      convert_to 0
      capability
      {
        construction_cost_bonus_wooden bonus 3 requires not hidden_resource africa and not hidden_resource tartars and not hidden_resource egypt and not hidden_resource abbasid and not hidden_resource jerusalem and not hidden_resource zengid and not hidden_resource cumans and event_counter TECHNOLOGY_WHEELBARROW 1

        trade_base_income_bonus bonus 1

; BONUSES FOR AI
		construction_cost_bonus_wooden bonus 10 requires event_counter ai_level_hard 1
        construction_cost_bonus_wooden bonus 15 requires event_counter ai_level_veryhard 1

		law_bonus bonus 1 requires event_counter ai_level_hard 1
		law_bonus bonus 2 requires event_counter ai_level_veryhard 1

;---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
; UPKEEP/INCOME	
        income_bonus bonus -50 requires not resource timber	
        income_bonus bonus 50 requires factions { middle_eastern, } and resource timber
        income_bonus bonus 100 requires factions { northern_european, eastern_european, southern_european, greek, } and resource timber and event_counter TECHNOLOGY_SAWMILL 1
      }
      material wooden
      construction  4
      cost  2000
      settlement_min town
      upgrades
      {
      builders2
      }
    }
;==================================================================================================================================
;===================   BUILDERS 2 (Carpenters)   ==================================================================================
;==================================================================================================================================		
    builders2 requires factions { northern_european, middle_eastern, eastern_european, greek, southern_european, } and not building_present_min_level grasslands nomad_encampment and building_present hinterland_roads or building_present hinterland_castle_roads
    {
      convert_to 1
      capability
      {
        construction_cost_bonus_wooden bonus 5 requires not hidden_resource africa and not hidden_resource tartars and not hidden_resource egypt and not hidden_resource abbasid and not hidden_resource jerusalem and not hidden_resource zengid and not hidden_resource cumans

        trade_base_income_bonus bonus 2

; BONUSES FOR AI
		construction_cost_bonus_wooden bonus 10 requires event_counter ai_level_hard 1
        construction_cost_bonus_wooden bonus 15 requires event_counter ai_level_veryhard 1

		law_bonus bonus 2 requires event_counter ai_level_hard 1
		law_bonus bonus 3 requires event_counter ai_level_veryhard 1
		
;---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
; UPKEEP/INCOME		
        income_bonus bonus -100 requires not resource timber
        income_bonus bonus 100 requires factions { middle_eastern, } and resource timber
        income_bonus bonus 150 requires factions { northern_european, eastern_european, southern_european, greek, } and resource timber and event_counter TECHNOLOGY_SAWMILL 1
      }
      material wooden
      construction  6

;==================================================================================================================================
;==================================================================================================================================
;---- Landowners ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
;==================================================================================================================================

; Policy building: signifies direct management of land by the faction's elites.
; An alternative building to autonomy - it provides military units and some law, trade, farm; but do not lower the unrest (as autonomy does).
; Available in both city and castle in any province on the map (de facto: not in deserts and some steppe provindes where agriculture is not possible to be built).
; Available already at the large_town level also for the gameplay purposes: access to heavy troops for the less developed faction.
 
; The landowners were the main engine of the trade but they also would take away a large chunk of the royal income.
;    therefore there's "trade_base_income_bonus" and "income_bonus" malus
; Criterion "farms2" excludes 8 provinces with deserts and 5 provinces with deep steppes.
; The nomadic factions have large malus to their happiness and will find it very difficult build them because they cannot build hinterland_farms.
; For landowning the existence of a settled agriculture is necessary but no religion threshold.

; Give access to the knights as this is the class that owned the lands (in the future may be also for the seargants / retainers - but then what will the stable be for?)
; Religious requirement only for recruitment (25% for knights, 50% for generals) - it signifies control of the land.
; Currently (098) disabled because there're errors "unlimited recruitment": bodyguards are available from settlements of 4th (Large City / Citadel) and 5th (Huge City).
; The AI has additional replenishment of the pools at any level, and can recruit Bodyguards at any level.

; Rows: consequite events in faciton evolution, Columns: consequtive levels of a building
;  (I)   0.03 : 33.3 turns,		0.04 : 25 turns,		0.055 : 18.2 turns, 	0.077  : 13.0 turns,	0.11 : 9,1 turns   (differences:  8.3 - 6.8 - 5.2 - 3.9)
;  (II)  0.04 : 25 turns,		0.055 : 18.2 turns, 	0.07 : 14.3 turns,	 	0.09   : 11,1 turns,	0.124 : 8,0 turns  (differences:  7.8 - 3.9 - 3.2 - 3.1)
;  (III) 0.05 : 20 turns,		0.06 : 15.1 turns,		0.085 : 11.8 turns, 	0.11  : 9,1 turns,		0.15 : 6,66 turns  (differences:  4.9 - 3.3 - 2.7 - 2.4)
;  (IV)  0.06 : 16.7 turns,		0.076 : 13.0 turns,		0.1 : 10.0 turns, 		0.13  : 7,7 turns,		0.18 : 5,56 turns  (differences:  3.7 - 3.0 - 2.3 - 2.1)
; This is very much for orientation, and is not upheld in the numbers below, sorry.

; Current state of revamp of the building chain:
;  done with faction evolution events: Georgia, Lithuania, Poland, Hungary
;  done thoroughly with number of a standard Latin evolution: England, Scotland, France, HRE, Sicily, Pisa, Venice, Papal States, Spain, Aragon, Portugal, Denmark, Norway, Serbia, Byzantium,
;  done superficially (for all levels: slight increase of numbers, with one event of progression): Russia, Kievan_Rus, 

; When all rosters are updated, copy the code (and then search-and-replace) to core castle building to attain two goals:
; - boost for home provinces (eg. "and hidden_resource denmark")
; - boost for castles
; - boost for capitals?

; Currently a standard evolution of a faction is: (T - tier of a knight unit)
; 	0:	 BEGINNING: 			T1 main
;	140: HEAVY_MAIL: 			T1 late + T2 early
;	310: TRANSITIONAL_ARMOR: 	T2 middle + T3 early
;	380: PAVISE_SHIELDS
;	440: HALF_PLATE_ARMOR		T2 late + T3 middle
;	510: FULL_PLATE_ARMOR
;	600: MATCHLOCK				T3 late
; perhaps periods of existence of only one tier T2 could be introduced? In this case the max numbers should be reviewed.

; Actually, the building should be destroyed once one faction takes over a province from another (it is why HURB has a separate chain for each faction).
; Or rather it should be religion-specific?
; One could do it with "temple_" prefix and making 4 types of this building (as it's not possible to destroy it by script).

;==================================================================================================================================
;==================================================================================================================================
;---- Local autonomy --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
;==================================================================================================================================
; This is a policy - built quickly (but not instantly) and rather cheaply.
; It exchanges law for happiness (and other mali) - enables keeping control of a region while sacrificing some income.
; The population of the region will also grow (because happiness gives growth).
; Gameplaywise: it is meant to be built in the outlaying regions where there's no factional nobility.

; It's not available for the AI because it will not know when to build it. There's a script disbanding it every 25 years.


;@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@    AUTONOMY
building autonomy
{
  convert_to autonomy
  religion heretic
  levels autonomy3 autonomy4
  {
    autonomy3 requires factions { northern_european, middle_eastern, eastern_european, greek, southern_european, }  and not building_present_min_level landowners landowners2 and event_counter is_the_player 1 
    {
      convert_to 0		
      capability
      {
		happiness_bonus bonus 5
		trade_base_income_bonus bonus -3
		religion_level bonus -3

;==============================================================================================================================
;- JERUSALEM Autonomy of Local Nobility ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

	; only in city of Jerusalem - doesn't make much sense as you wouldn't grant it autonomy as the KoJ
		recruit_pool	"Constable of Jerusalem"	1	0.06   3  0  requires factions { jerusalem, } and event_counter HEAVY_MAIL_ARMOR 1 and hidden_resource jerusalem and hidden_resource capital
	; only in city of Edessa - a bit of waste to have one unit for one province
		recruit_pool	"Edessan Guard"	1	0.09   3  0  requires factions { jerusalem, } and event_counter HEAVY_MAIL_ARMOR 1 and hidden_resource jerusalem and hidden_resource zengid and hidden_resource armenia
	
;---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
; UPKEEP/INCOME	
        income_bonus bonus -200
		}	
      material wooden
      construction 2
      cost  3000
      settlement_min large_town
      upgrades
      {
        autonomy4
      }
    }
    autonomy4 requires factions { northern_european, middle_eastern, eastern_european, greek, southern_european, } and not building_present_min_level landowners landowners2 and event_counter is_the_player 1
    {
      convert_to 1
      capability
      {
		happiness_bonus bonus 9
		trade_base_income_bonus bonus -5
		religion_level bonus -5

;==============================================================================================================================
;- JERUSALEM Autonomy of Provincial Nobility ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

		recruit_pool	"Constable of Jerusalem"	1	0.09   4  0  requires factions { jerusalem, } and event_counter HEAVY_MAIL_ARMOR 1 and hidden_resource jerusalem and hidden_resource capital
		recruit_pool	"Edessan Guard"	1	0.13   4  0  requires factions { jerusalem, } and event_counter HEAVY_MAIL_ARMOR 1 and hidden_resource jerusalem and hidden_resource zengid and hidden_resource armenia
		
;---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
; UPKEEP/INCOME	
        income_bonus bonus -400		
      }
      material wooden
      construction  4
      cost  6000
      settlement_min city
      upgrades
      {
      }
    }
  }
  plugins

  }
}

;==================================================================================================================================
;---- Tribute ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
;==================================================================================================================================
; It's not available for the AI because it would not know how and when to build it.
; For the intial / conqured by the AI buildings, there's a script disbanding it every 25 years.

;@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@
building food_supply
{
  levels foodsupport tribute_management forced_tribute
  {
    foodsupport city requires factions { northern_european, middle_eastern, eastern_european, greek, southern_european, } and building_present_min_level hinterland_roads paved_roads and building_present_min_level city_hall council_chambers and event_counter is_the_player 1
    {
      capability
      {
        population_growth_bonus bonus 3
        happiness_bonus bonus 1
;---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
; UPKEEP/INCOME	
        income_bonus bonus -100		
      }
      faction_capability
		{
		population_growth_bonus bonus -1
		happiness_bonus bonus -1			
		}
      material wooden
      construction  4
      cost  5000
      settlement_min city
      upgrades
      {
      tribute_management
      }
    }
    tribute_management city requires factions { northern_european, middle_eastern, eastern_european, greek, southern_european, } and building_present_min_level hinterland_roads paved_roads and building_present_min_level city_hall city_hall and event_counter is_the_player 1
    {
      capability
      {
        population_growth_bonus bonus 6
        happiness_bonus bonus 2        
;---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
; UPKEEP/INCOME	
        income_bonus bonus -200		
      }
      faction_capability
		{
		population_growth_bonus bonus -2
		happiness_bonus bonus -2
		}
      material wooden
      construction  5
      cost  10000
      settlement_min city
      upgrades
      {
      forced_tribute
      }
    }
    forced_tribute city requires factions { northern_european, middle_eastern, eastern_european, greek, southern_european, } and building_present_min_level hinterland_roads paved_roads and building_present_min_level city_hall mayors_palace and event_counter is_the_player 1
    {
      capability
      {
        population_growth_bonus bonus 9
        happiness_bonus bonus 3    
;---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
; UPKEEP/INCOME	
        income_bonus bonus -400		
      }
      faction_capability
		{
		population_growth_bonus bonus -3
		happiness_bonus bonus -4
		}
      material wooden
      construction  6
      cost  15000
      settlement_min large_city
      upgrades
      {
      }
    }
  }
  plugins
  {
  }
}


;==============================================================================================================================
;==============================================================================================================================
;---- Justice (gallows) -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
;==============================================================================================================================
; It's not available for the AI because it will not know when to build it.
; It is destroyed once a settlement is conquered - to this end you need lines for both city and castle, and also the line "religion heretic"
;        Mind that you need a settlement type designation for it to work (ie: jus_1 city requires ....)
; In case a bug happens - there's a script disbanding AI gallows every 25 years.

;@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@ 
building justice_city
{
  convert_to justice_castle
  religion heretic
  levels justice_city_1_gallows
  {
    justice_city_1_gallows city requires factions { northern_european, eastern_european, southern_european, greek, middle_eastern, } and event_counter is_the_player 1
    {
      capability
      {
        law_bonus bonus 8 requires not event_counter FL_policy_shady_connections 1 
        law_bonus bonus 10 requires event_counter FL_policy_shady_connections 1 
        happiness_bonus bonus -2
        population_growth_bonus bonus -4 
		trade_base_income_bonus bonus -2 
        religion_level bonus -1
;---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
; UPKEEP/INCOME		
		income_bonus bonus -100		
      }
      material wooden
      construction  1
      cost  1000
      settlement_min city
      upgrades
      {
      }
    }
  }
  plugins
  {
  }
}

building justice_castle
{
  convert_to justice_city
  religion heretic
  levels justice_castle_1_gallows
  {
    justice_castle_1_gallows castle requires factions { northern_european, eastern_european, southern_european, greek, middle_eastern, } and event_counter is_the_player 1
    {
      capability
      {
        law_bonus bonus 8 requires not event_counter FL_policy_shady_connections 1 
        law_bonus bonus 10 requires event_counter FL_policy_shady_connections 1 
        happiness_bonus bonus -2
        population_growth_bonus bonus -4
		trade_base_income_bonus bonus -2 
        religion_level bonus -1
;---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
; UPKEEP/INCOME		
		income_bonus bonus -100		
      }
      material wooden
      construction  1
      cost  1000
      settlement_min city
      upgrades
      {
      }
    }
  }
  plugins
  {
  }
}

;==================================================================================================================================
;==================================================================================================================================
;---- Barracks -----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
;==================================================================================================================================
;==================================================================================================================================
; Barracs in the cities give the basic militias and (upper levels) a very limited number of professional units.
; The units relate to the urban popultion so the links with "hidden resources" is very limited
; thust a faction can recruit these units everywhere on the map.
; Unlike barracks in the castle, here they discourage immigration - so negative population bonus at higher levels.


;@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@    BARRACKS
building barracks
{
  convert_to castle_barracks
  levels town_watch town_guard city_watch militia_drill_square militia_barracks army_barracks royal_armoury
  {
;==================================================================================================================================
;===================  TOWN WATCH   ================================================================================================
;==================================================================================================================================

    town_watch city requires factions { northern_european, middle_eastern, eastern_european, greek, southern_european, }
    {
      convert_to 1
      capability
		{
        population_growth_bonus bonus -1
        law_bonus bonus 1
		
;====================================================================================================================================
;- TOWN WATCH - AREA OF RECRUITMENT -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
;====================================================================================================================================


;'''''''''''''''''''''''''  below is THE MOTHER OF THE AoR UNITS SCRIPT FOR BARRACKS ''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''
;  modify here, then cut-and-paste to all levels of barracks for city and castle
;  put here only units available for "all" factions
;  if a faction merits having more recruitment of this unit (eg. because it's a factional unit)
;	(eg "Lithuanian Skirmishers" unit for Lithuania)
;	then add recruitment in the faction part in the form of "0   0.04	0  0"
;	to avoid mistakes: in each places put the last number (experience) : 0
; - number of recruits does not grow with the urbanization level

; ************************************************************************************************************************************
; **--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------**
; **----                            START  Area of Recruitment: barracks (city and castle)                                    ------**

; **--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------**
; ************************************************************************************************************************************

;==============================================================================================================================
;==============================================================================================================================
;------- Ranges ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
;==============================================================================================================================
;==============================================================================================================================

;								THE FRAMEWORK TO BE ACHIEVED FOR EACH FACTION
; Evolutions:
; 	lvl0 (motte_and_bailey, doesn't exits atm): only AoR archers
; 	lvl1 (wooden_castle): + Levy Archers evolving in the late game into regular Archers
; 	lvl2 (castle): + Archers, evolving into a better unit if availab; + (only for the Latin factions) + Crossbow Militia
; 	lvl3 (fortress): + better archer unit, + Crossbow Militia; + higher max limit; in late game: more starting experience
; 	lvl4 (citadel): starting with hither experience (1/3), and also higher max limit.
; 		the increase of recruitment pools from level to level increases only marginally, eg by 0.02
;		while for the AoR tribal units it does not at all

;												RECRUITMENT RULES

;  - crossbow should be available only after the events:
;		LATERAN_COUNCIL2 (turn 16) - for the Latin West (it's already in the text of the event)
;		OSTSIEDLUNG (turn ca. 140) - for Poland, Hungary, Serbia
;		RUS_CROSSBOWS (turn ca. 140) - for Kiev and Novgorod
;		LITHUANIA3_MINDAUGAS (turn ca. 200) - for Lithuania, as it signifies the beginning of Westernization
;				210: MOUNTED_CROSSBOWS - better crossbows in the West
;		BYZANTIUM2_ANNA_COMNENA (turn ca. 70) - for Byzantium, as it signifies the Westernization
;		GEORGIAN4_CROSSBOW_IN_CAUCASUS (turn ca. 250) - for Georgia, as it signifies contacts with the crusaders
;				510: FULL_PLATE_ARMOR - crossbow starts being phased out

; - the AoR units:
;	- they recruitment pool filling doesn't grow: it is the same for all levels of the settlement
;	- experience:
;		never give experience in this (=AoR) section other than 0
;		because for many factions there's an additional recruitment pool increase
;       an it will work only if the units are indentical

;												RULES for CAPABILITIES
; each level provides +1 law
; population bonus only for the city-levels as the town and large_town have enough growth from the other sources

; this unit is now in-game called "Forest Archers"
; up to SSHIP 098 only Lithuania and Poland, made AoR by kostic in 2021 - then deleted from factional buildings for Poland (so: only AoR and factional Lithuania)
; better than Hunters but limited in area (only in the Baltics from Bowyer, from the upper buildings also from Scandinavia)
; useful throughout all times
; before changing stuff here, check Lithuania recruitment

; Forest Archers in Lithuania

		recruit_pool	"Lithuanian Archers"	1	0.05	2  0  requires factions { all, } and hidden_resource lithuania

		recruit_pool	"Lithuanian Archers"	1	0.05	2  0  requires factions { all, } and hidden_resource norway or hidden_resource denmark

; IMPORTANT: for the prefix "temple_" to work there must be also city\castle definition
;      thus there must be two sets for each temple !!! 

; CODING:
; - only one religion can be assigned to a building chain (religion_level)
; - it works 0.5% per increment 
; - however, you can have multiple buildings in the same settlement each converting to different religions.

; attention: there're missions related to the churches defined in the descr_missions.txt - so keep the current names!
